alt_text: Screenshot of error message 'Title is required' displayed in red text below the task form. The error div has no ARIA attributes visible in browser DevTools inspector panel.
context: P2 (screen reader user) submitted blank task title. NVDA did not announce this error message because it lacks role='alert' or aria-live attributes.
pii_check: ✅ Browser tabs cropped; no personal data visible

alt_text: Screenshot of error message 'Error: Title is required' with browser DevTools showing the error div now has role='alert' and aria-live='assertive' attributes highlighted in the HTML inspector.
context: After implementing Fix #1. P5 (NVDA user) confirmed this error was announced immediately with the text 'Error: Title is required'.
pii_check: ✅ Browser tabs cropped; no personal data visible

alt_text: Screenshot of browser Developer Console showing an infinite loop of 'focus' events on the filter button. Console logs show 'filter-btn: focus event fired' repeating 15+ times. The button element is highlighted in the Elements panel showing onfocus='this.select()' attribute.
context: P3 attempted to Tab past the filter button but focus became trapped. The onfocus handler was re-selecting the button, preventing Tab from advancing to the next element.
pii_check: ✅ No personal data; console shows generic test data only

alt_text: Screenshot of the edit button in the task list with no visible focus outline. Browser DevTools shows the button element selected but no CSS rules applying focus styles. Computed styles panel shows outline: none.
context: P4 (keyboard-only user) could not see which button had focus when navigating with Tab key. This violates WCAG 2.4.7 Level AA.
pii_check: ✅ Task content is generic test data; no PII

alt_text: Screenshot of axe DevTools accessibility scan results showing '0 violations found' with green checkmark. The scan analyzed 15 elements and shows all WCAG 2.1 Level A and AA criteria passing.
context: Final regression testing after all fixes implemented. Confirms no remaining WCAG violations. Used to verify Part A of verification.csv checklist.
pii_check: ✅ No personal data in scan results

alt_text: Screenshot of validation error message saying 'Invalid input' in red text. No indication of which field is invalid or what the correct format should be.
context: P1 attempted to submit a task with blank title and received generic 'Invalid input' error. Quote: 'Error says invalid but doesn't tell me what's wrong'.
pii_check: ✅ No PII visible; form contains generic test data

alt_text: Screenshot of improved validation error message: 'Task title cannot be empty. Please enter a title (e.g., Buy groceries, Call dentist).' Message includes both the problem and actionable examples.
context: After implementing Fix #3. Error message now explains what's wrong and provides examples of valid input, meeting WCAG 3.3.3 Level AA.
pii_check: ✅ No PII visible; form contains generic test data

alt_text: Screenshot of task list containing 15 tasks, all with identical visual styling (black text, no color coding, no visual hierarchy). Tasks are 'Task 1' through 'Task 15' with varying priorities (1-5) but no visual distinction.
context: P1 comment at 15:12: 'Hard to find specific task in long list'. P2 comment at 15:34: 'All tasks look same, no hierarchy'. Demonstrates need for visual prioritization (color, size, grouping).
pii_check: ✅ All task content is generic test data (Task 1-15); no PII
